intro: Grumilea morindoides, commonly known as the African star apple, is a tropical shrub native to Africa. It belongs to the family Morindaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both aesthetic and practical purposes.
